transcript: â€‰ The musician was due to perform at The Dome in Liverpool on Friday, July 11 Gabrielle Rockson 11 July 2025 at 3:30 pmÂ·3-min read Link copied Jed Cullen/Dave Benett/Getty Yungblud at the Burberry Winter 2025 show during London Fashion Week on February 24, 2025 NEED TO KNOW Yungblud is postponing his Liverpool show due to being diagnosed with tonsillitis Fans were given free drinks as compensation Yungblud is postponing his show for health reasons â€” but leaving fans with a gift. On Thursday, July 10, the singer-songwriter, 27, revealed that he's had to postpone his show in Liverpool, England due to suffering from tonsillitis. Making the announcement on his Instagram Stories, Yungblud â€” born Dominic Richard Harrison â€” shared he wouldn't be able to make his Liverpool gig, where he was due to perform at The Dome on Friday, July 11. "My f---ing tonsillitis still hasn't cleared up so I'm getting steroid treatment," he wrote on his Instagram Stories. "I have plans to get the f---ers out as they're a weak point for me but I need to find some time as obviously we've been non stop." He added, "I'm ready to rock but my body is letting me down this week, I hate being in bed it terrifies me." Never miss a story â€” sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer, from juicy celebrity news to compelling human interest stories. Yungblud/Instagram Yungblud on Instagram Stories The musician went on to state that doctors have told him to "postpone Liverpool even though I can still sing." "Please understand I hate letting you down. I wanna say f--- it and just do it but they said I could really do damage to my voice," he continued. The PEOPLE Puzzler crossword is here! How quickly can you solve it? Play now! "I love you all and I will DEFINITELY be at Bristol and Southampton next week," Yungblud added. "Adore you all forever. I cannot believe what's happening at the minute. Beautiful." In another post, the star revealed that he "put some money behind the bar at @motel_bar" in Liverpool so fans could get a free drink at the bar if they show their tickets. Samir Hussein/WireImage Yungblud in London in April 2025 "I'm so sad I can't be there but at least you can be together and celebrate each other, as that's what Yungblud is all about," he wrote. "Go to the bar, play the tunes and have a good time. I love you. Again, I'm truly sorry." Yungblud's announcement comes after his health forced him to cancel his show in Dundee the night before, according to The Courier. The artist, who released his new album Idols in June, is set to kick off his North American leg on Aug. 23 in Los Angeles. Yungblud also announced on Instagram that his new documentary Are You Ready, Boy? will be released in theaters on Aug. 20 and 24. Read the original article on People

transcript: â€‰ Okay, here's a breakdown of the information presented in the text, organized for clarity. It appears to be a customer service guide regarding refunds,specifically related to taxes and customs duties when returning goods to Korea. I. General Refund Information (First Section) Voluntary Reporting is Key: If you don't voluntarily report the goods for tax purposes upon entering Korea, you cannot get a refund. Taxation customs Clearance Refund: This section details the documents needed for a refund related to taxes paid during customs clearance. Portable taxation customs clearance statement (requires voluntary reporting) Payment receipt (for the taxes paid) Return and refunding water confirmation (issued by duty-free shops) Personal information usage agreement Refund application (implied) II. Volunteer Disposal Products/Refund/Tax Refund Information Refund Process: Report the goods voluntarily when entering Korea. Taxation is possible with a taxation customs clearance statement (customs salary) and a payment receipt. Necessary documents for Refund: Refund application Customs clearance statement Return and refund confirmation (from duty-free shops) Copy of deposit accounts (for receiving the refund) UNIPASS System: Refunds can be applied for through the UNIPASS system (korea Customs Service's electronic system) if all requirements and documents are met. III. Refunds for Goods Below the Tax Exemption Threshold No reporting needed: Exchanges and refunds for goods below the tax exemption threshold don't require reporting or customs procedures. Duty-Free Goods exchange: Exchanging duty-free goods requires cancellation and must follow the duty-free shop's purchase and delivery process from the departure hall. Company Pays: (The text is cut off here,but implies the company covers some cost). In essence, the document outlines a process for getting refunds on taxes paid on imported goods that are being returned to Korea, emphasizing the importance of voluntary reporting and providing a list of required documentation. Key Takeaways: Voluntary reporting: This is the most important aspect. Documentation: Gather all the listed documents before applying for a refund. UNIPASS: The primary system for processing refunds. * Duty-Free Specifics: Duty-free purchases have a different exchange process. Renowned for its fashionable products, competitive prices, elegant shopping environment, and warm, high-quality services [[2]], Shilla Duty Free attracts both domestic and international tourists. Located next to the Hotel Shilla [[1]], it offers differentiated hotel-style services, including a guest lounge and cafeteria, as well as high-class facilities [[1]]. Why Shop at Shilla Duty Free? transcript: â€‰ Hey yall, Been out the game a while & looking at prices these days I figured aside from trying out testers I could perhaps get some advice from some more seasoned folks (pardon the pun). Long story short, the descriptions just do not compute for me. This isn't just with cologne either, but also weed. When someone describes something as nutty or woody, I do not get that at all. I don't smell almond or vanilla, but I do smell the baby powered smell I've seen people use to describe it. So idk. Hoping to just kind of use examples of the vibes I like and see if maybe someone can point me in the right direction. I've used AI to the best of my ability with this, but it refuses to give me actual recommendations outside ones I've already tried (and told it about) and the same handful. Also, the relevant factors coming into play outside of preference are: - I'm 35; - I work in the legal field; and - I'm a cigarette smoker So, when I was young my go-to was Abercrombie fierce, then graduating to aqua De Gio as one did from 2005-2011, perhaps they still do idk lol. Those are too â€œfreshâ€ and â€œyoungâ€ to me tho nowadays. I wore guilty by Gucci & Gucci by Gucci in the past and would fluctuate between really liking one and not the other. My favorite female scent is D&G Light Blue, but the male version didn't really do it for me. I bought the Yves Saint Laurent [here](https://www.macys.com/shop/product/yves-saint-laurent-mens-2-pc.-y-myslf-eau-de-parfum-gift-set?ID=19213960&cm_mmc=SMS-_-MAPP_pdpshare-_-n-_-nâ€) And while I like them both, I want something a tad â€œheavierâ€. I also bought a tester of Tom Ford's Fucking Fabulous and I really enjoy it but the â€œbaby powderâ€ smell that is present bugs me enough to not wanna fork over the money for a full bottle. But I very much enjoy the â€œcomplexityâ€ or â€œlayersâ€ I guess you'd say? And despite being a sweeter smell it endures cigarettes well. Sauvage is good until it isn't. No disrespect but I get axe body spray vibes from it but the grown up version. Bleu is awesome but everyone I know has it. My ex got me a jimmy choo one that I can't recall the exact name of that was so-so but didn't really blow my hair back. Would love you feedback on what u think I should look into more. The ones I've been considering are: - Le Male by SPG - Afternoon Swim (concern is lasting power) - Jazz Club by MM - Valentino Uomo Born in Roma -  Burberry Weekend -  Terre d'HermÃ¨s - Tom Ford Oud Wood And then based on the descriptions I feel like I prob won't like spice bomb but who knows. Any and all help is greatly appreciated!

transcript: â€‰ ASTRO's Cha Eun-Woo will commence his services on July 28. Before the services, he organized a fun meet and greet with his fans in Seoul. Cha Eun Woo delivers a surprise performance K-Pop boyband ASTRO member Cha Eun-Woo has recently sent his fans into a frenzy following his surprise performance. The singer and actor surprised his fans with an exciting performance on the upbeat track from the animated film KPop Demon Hunters, Soda Pop, creating a buzz among the fans. Several videos from his performance are going viral on social media. True Beauty fame actor recently organised a fan meeting event, The Royal, in Seoul ahead of mandatory military enlistment. Story continues below During the event, Eun-Woo delighted his fans with the viral Saja Boys song Soda Pop. For his performance, the singer wore a royal-inspired outfit, channelling a prince-like look that matched the event's regal theme. He brought charm and vibrant energy to the stage with ease. The singer took to his social media to share the behind-the-scenes of the event. He penned in the caption, â€œI was Happy.â€ The singer's latest performance came as he prepares for his upcoming mandatory military enlistment. He will commence his services on July 28. For the unversed, Cha Eun-Woo made his solo debut in February 2024 with his EP Entity, featuring the lead single Stay. Meanwhile, Eun-Woo's credits also include acting, and he has delivered stellar performances in K-dramas like True Beauty, Island, and Sweet Revenge, among others. Apart from his work in music and acting, Eun-Woo has made a significant impact in the fashion industry. He represents major global brands like Calvin Klein, Dior, and Burberry as a brand ambassador. His rising influence in fashion has gained him wide recognition, including a place on Elle Thailand's list of 30 Most Inspiring People.

The singer and actor surprised his fans with an exciting performance on the upbeat track from the animated film KPop Demon Hunters, Soda Pop, creating a buzz among the fans. Several videos from his performance are going viral on social media. True Beauty fame actor recently organised a fan meeting event, The Royal, in Seoul ahead of mandatory military enlistment. Story continues below During the event, Eun-Woo delighted his fans with the viral Saja Boys song Soda Pop. For his performance, the singer wore a royal-inspired outfit, channelling a prince-like look that matched the event's regal theme. He brought charm and vibrant energy to the stage with ease. The singer took to his social media to share the behind-the-scenes of the event. He penned in the caption, â€œI was Happy.â€ The singer's latest performance came as he prepares for his upcoming mandatory military enlistment. He will commence his services on July 28. For the unversed, Cha Eun-Woo made his solo debut in February 2024 with his EP Entity, featuring the lead single Stay. Meanwhile, Eun-Woo's credits also include acting, and he has delivered stellar performances in K-dramas like True Beauty, Island, and Sweet Revenge, among others. Apart from his work in music and acting, Eun-Woo has made a significant impact in the fashion industry. He represents major global brands like Calvin Klein, Dior, and Burberry as a brand ambassador. His rising influence in fashion has gained him wide recognition, including a place on Elle Thailand's list of 30 Most Inspiring People.

The mention is meaningful and directly relates to Burberry's brand positioning in the fashion and entertainment industry.

transcript: â€‰ By Wayne Noir - RION magazine. London's fashion landscape is about to feel a seismic shift. After a hiatus from the live runway, designer Joshua Kane is poised to make a thunderous return with Bespoken Dreamâ€”a new immersive show premiering July 16 at The Mandrake Hotel. Known for blurring the line between fashion and theatre, Kane's work doesn't merely drape the bodyâ€”it commands it, turning silhouettes into storylines, buttons into punctuation marks, and seams into symphonic verses. For those unfamiliar with the name (though rare in the world of bespoke), Joshua Kane is far from a conventional tailor. Born in Oxfordshire in 1984, Kane's early years saw him toggling between semi-professional football and sketching designs  in his bedroom. He later enrolled at Kingston University, graduating with a First in Fashion Design, before cutting his teeth at Brooks Brothers in New York, Burberry Prorsum under Christopher Bailey, and ultimately as Senior Designer at Paul Smith. But Kane always had his eyes set on creating his own worldâ€”one in which craftsmanship collided unapologetically with performance. That world came to life in 2014, when Kane founded his namesake label out of his London flat. Within months, his Savile Row-level precision and Edwardian-inflected suiting were walking their own runway at London Collections Men. Soon after, a pop-up in Spitalfields gave way to a flagship on Great Portland Street, then evolved into a private showroom nestled inside a Marylebone townhouse. His studio quickly became more than a space for fittingsâ€”it became a stage. Unlike most designers, Kane doesn't believe in traditional fashion shows. â€œI never wanted to do a normal catwalk,â€ he once told Brummell Magazine. And he meant it. Each of his past showcasesâ€”be it the cinematic rush of Journey at the London Palladium, or the surreal drama of 2023's Shipwrecked Tailorsâ€”have drawn comparisons to West End productions. With choreographed movement, live musical scoring, and a cast of dancers, actors, and models, these events blur the boundaries of narrative, couture, and set design. And while the clothes are always the centerpiece, they exist within a living, breathing universe. But Kane's vision extends beyond the physical. In 2023, he dove headlong into the digital realm, designing garments for avatars and metaverse identities, minting NFTs, and testing the limits of digital tailoringâ€”proving once again that tradition, in his hands, is no anchor. Now, with Bespoken Dream, Kane's myth-making reaches new heights. Details remain tightly under wraps, but early hints suggest the show will be his most intricate yetâ€”a celebration of fine tailoring and fantasy told through an all-sensory spectacle. Set within the lush, dimly-lit corridors of The Mandrake, it promises couture not just worn, but performed. His fabric, famously woven exclusively in the UK, will be center stage. Each thread, each trim, painstakingly customâ€”an anthem of Kane's commitment to heritage and rebellion in equal measure. The show also coincides with a series of public studio events later this yearâ€”rare open hours where clients and collectors alike can glimpse the inner workings of Kane's atelier, perhaps even catch him mid-drape or deep in discussion with his creative team. That proximity is rare in a fashion world often hidden behind PR gates, but then again, Kane has always done things differently. Among those who've worn his designs: Rod Stewart, Jack Whitehall, Jason Momoa, and Tom Holland. His garments have graced the small screen via Bridgerton, She-Hulk, and Frontier. Yet for Kane, the celebrity name-drop has always taken a back seat to craftsmanship. â€œMy goal was never to be famous,â€ he once said. â€œIt was to make clothes that speak for themselves.â€ And speak they do. Whether standing still on a mannequin or flying down a runway surrounded by fog and violins, a Joshua Kane piece is unmistakable. This is fashion that doesn't whisper. It narrates. It dreams. And come July 16, it returnsâ€”with a vengeance. Joshuakanebespoke.com
